intro: Borreria vegeta, commonly known as the Mexican milkweed, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink, often with a faintly fragrant scent. Borreria vegeta is adapted to thrive in arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in tropical and subtropical regions. Its latex sap contains milky secretions, which can be used in traditional medicinal practices.
